sentences.sContent: Quasimodo moves into the bell tower of a cathedral and becomes the hunchback of Notre Dame.
sentences.sContent_eng: Quasimodo moves into the bell tower of a cathedral and becomes the hunchback of Notre Dame.
sentences.sCn: 卡西莫多搬进了一座天主教堂的钟楼里，成了巴黎圣母院的敲钟驼背人。

sentences.sContent: The hunchback in the corner by the wall exulted.
sentences.sContent_eng: The hunchback in the corner by the wall exulted.
sentences.sCn: 壁角的驼背忽然高兴起来。

sentences.sContent: When I looked down the hall I saw what looked like a transparent hunchback limping toward us.
sentences.sContent_eng: When I looked down the hall I saw what looked like a transparent hunchback limping toward us.
sentences.sCn: 我向下看，看到一个驼背的跛子向我们走来。

trans.tranOther: an offensive word for someone who has a large raised part on their back because their  spine  curves in an unusual way
